application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: New York, NY, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA
description:
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

The Ads Research and Insights team conducts primary research and uses internal data to uncover consumer insights.

As a Manager focusing on Research and Insights, you'll be responsible for mining data and designing and executing third-party research to illustrate how consumer behavior is quickly changing and how consumers interact with technology. You'll transform the data into actionable consumer insights that shapes Google’s point of view and compels marketers to change their approach to advertising.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Market Research, Psychology, Social Science, Statistics, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of market research or analytics experience.
  • Experience with data analysis, principles of experimental design, survey design and/or clickstream analysis, and qualitative research.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 2 years of experience developing compelling insights narratives that communicate research findings to global audiences.
  • Experience writing SQL queries.
  • Ability to understand human behavior, with a strategic mindset and excellent business acumen.
  • Curious and creative. Passion for surfacing real-world trends in media, marketing, technology, and consumer behavior, and keeping up with macro news and trends.
  • Technical and analytical skills combined with a curiosity and a passion for storytelling and marketing.
responsibilities:
• Use data to identify insights that will change how marketers think about consumer behavior and digital marketing.
  • Transform complex data into compelling insights narratives to communicate research findings.
  • Analyze data and craft consumer insights for marketing storytelling.
  • Manage multiple projects and stakeholders simultaneously in order to embed insights into marketing.
  • Translate business needs into research and/or data analysis plans to uncover actionable answers.
title: Research and Insights Manager, Ads Marketing
